title: Homeless Shelter Gets Green Light; Neighborhood Group Plans Appeal
summary: Midtown shelter near Billionaires' Row clears legal hurdle as some residents object, citing fire safety concerns. A neighborhood group opposed to the opening of a homeless shelter in Midtown Manhattan said Wednesday that it would challenge a New York state appellate court decision allowing New York City to move forward with the project.

title: Huawei Pulls Laptop Launch as U.S. Restrictions Sting
summary: Chinese tech company also pauses production at its personal-computer business. HONG KONG-China's Huawei Technologies Co. has canceled the launch of a new laptop and paused production at its personal-computer business because of restrictions on buying U.S. components, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: House Panel Approves Bill Overhauling Federal Flood Insurance
summary: Bipartisan bill aims to spur private flood insurance and lower costs for lower-income homeowners. WASHINGTON-Lawmakers in the House advanced a bipartisan plan to overhaul the federal flood-insurance program, which has struggled to keep pace with record disaster payouts in recent years.

title: Wells Fargo: Help Wanted
summary: In which we attempt to help the bank attract a new CEO.. Wells Fargo , the once great bank and favorite of Warren Buffett, is having a hard time attracting a new CEO. The bank has lost two CEOs in three years, and the Journal reported this week that likely candidates are running away from the job. As a service to the bank's board of directors and shareholders, we thought we'd take a crack at writing a help-wanted notice for CEO that might have better luck attracting a suitable candidate. No payment necessary beyond subscribing to this newspaper. Here goes:

title: Biden Takes On 'Trump's Tariffs'
summary: The Democrat seems to think protectionism isn't popular in Iowa.. Are tariffs popular? Donald Trump seems to think so and, after nearly 18 months of imposing the border taxes willy-nilly, many Republicans seem to agree. They may soon get a political test of that proposition as Joe Biden, the Democratic leader in the 2020 race against Mr. Trump, took direct aim at the cost of tariffs in Iowa on Tuesday.

title: Cory Booker Wants to Pay Your Rent
summary: Subsidizing leases above 30% of income will push prices higher.. Every Presidential election spawns some ill-conceived ideas, but even by that standard Cory Booker's latest is a doozy. "Cory's Plan To Provide Safe, Affordable Housing For All Americans" would essentially cap rent at 30% of the tenant's income. Anything more would be paid by Uncle Sam.

title: Cybersecurity Firm CrowdStrike Soars in Wall Street Debut
summary: Shares climb 71%, valuing the company at roughly $11.6 billion. Shares in cybersecurity company CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. soared in their first day of trading Wednesday, closing up 71% from the IPO price and highlighting continued investor interest in fast-growing business-software firms.

title: Busy IPO Market Offers Lifeline to Troubled Retailers
summary: Neiman Marcus and PetSmart appease lenders with debt deals following fights over asset transfers. A thriving market for IPOs is helping ease tensions between a pair of struggling retailers and their lenders, as Neiman Marcus Group Ltd. and PetSmart Inc. explore selling their e-commerce platforms.

title: Trump, Duda Agree on More U.S. Troops in Poland
summary: Poland also agreed to buy U.S. jet fighters, liquefied natural gas. WASHINGTON-President Trump signed an agreement to send 1,000 additional U.S. troops to Poland while treating his visiting Polish counterpart to a military flyover at the White House as thanks for a commitment to buy F-35 jet fighters.

title: Suspect in Louisiana Church Fires Faces Federal Hate-Crime Charges
summary: Holden Matthews also charged in the state of Louisiana on burnings of African-American churches. NEW ORLEANS-The son of a Louisiana sheriff's deputy is facing federal hate-crime charges in connection with three fires that destroyed African-American churches earlier this year.

title: CFOs Grapple With How Much Cybersecurity Spending is Enough
summary: Strong relationships with the chief information security officer and other IT managers can help finance chiefs find comfort on spending. title: Oklahoma Army Post to Temporarily House Migrant Children
summary: Move to open up Fort Sill comes as apprehensions at the southern border rise sharply. Migrant children will be housed at an Army post in Oklahoma, as the government struggles to meet growing demands for shelter amid a sharp rise in immigrants being apprehended at the border.

title: Hope Hicks Agrees to Give Closed-Door Testimony to House Panel
summary: Hicks will testify before House Judiciary Committee next Wednesday. WASHINGTON-Former Trump aide Hope Hicks has agreed to provide closed-door testimony to the House Judiciary Committee, the panel's chairman said, a small breakthrough for congressional Democrats frustrated by the White House's resistance to their efforts to investigate President Trump.

title: The Trump-Biden Smackdown
summary: Trump's slurs pushed Cruz, Rubio and Bush off their games. Don't expect Biden to crack.. Standing on the White House lawn Tuesday on his way to Iowa, Donald Trump took questions from the press. Someone mentioned Joe Biden. Mr. Trump went zero to 60 in about 4.2 seconds: "He's a different guy," Mr. Trump said about the Democratic front-runner. "He looks different than he used to. He acts different than he used to. He's even slower than he used to be." Then came the punch line: "Joe Biden is a dummy."

title: An Abortion Red Herring in Alabama
summary: The real story behind Hugh Culverhouse's rejected donation to the state law school.. When the University of Alabama decided to return a $21.5 million donation to investor Hugh F. Culverhouse Jr. and remove his name from its law school, Mr. Culverhouse claimed it was retaliation for his speaking out against Alabama's new abortion law. But the university's decision had nothing to do with abortion.

title: John Dean's Watergate Business Model
summary: He's made a career of comparing every GOP president to the one he went to prison for.. With great fanfare Monday, House Judiciary Committee Democrats called John Dean as their kickoff witness in their drive to impeach President Trump. Mr. Dean served as President Nixon's White House counsel from 1970-73. Welcome to the wayback machine.

title: The Economist Who Helped Me Find My Calling
summary: Martin Feldstein taught me how rigorous analysis can shape policy and improve the lives of millions.. Martin S. Feldstein was a great economist who changed the world through research, teaching, public service, hundreds of op-eds in these pages over 40 years, and leadership of the National Bureau of Economic Research.

title: 'Conscience' Review: Wired to Care
summary: Observing rules aimed at the survival of our species seems to elicit pleasurable brain chemicals. Does this mean morality has its basis in oxytocin?. There are philosophers who devote their entire careers to understanding the relation between the brain, that lump of gray matter inside our craniums, and the mind, with all its emotional, sensual and cognitive splendors. It's not hard to see why. Not only is the relation a puzzle of profound interest in itself, but advances in biology and neuroscience have made it an urgent topic at the moment. Think of the aspirations of neuroeconomists to predict our consumer preferences to the nth degree, or the claims of brain scientists that our political beliefs are simply a matter of primitive chemical responses lodged in our reptilian cortex.

title: Four Decades of Economic Wisdom From Martin Feldstein
summary: Thoughts on the Reagan White House, inflation, Indian economic reform and America's debt crisis.. Editor's note: Martin Feldstein, a longtime Journal contributor, died Tuesday at 79. These are excerpts from a few of his op-eds.

title: Walmart to Fold Jet.com Staff Into Operations
summary: Retailer will eliminate Jet leadership, but will keep running Jet.com site. Walmart Inc. is absorbing what remains of Jet.com staff into the rest of its operations, winding down the startup it bought for $3.3 billion three years ago while continuing to run the Jet.com website.

title: RH's Restoration Is Back on Track
summary: Management of the company formerly known as Restoration Hardware might have earned the benefit of the doubt after sending short sellers fleeing. At the beginning of the year, RH , formerly known as Restoration Hardware, was celebrating a successful turnaround and beating back short sellers. The company has set itself apart from rivals like Pottery Barn and Crate & Barrel, improving quality and raising prices. At a time when many retailers are trying to adapt to digital ordering and shopping, RH went retro, printing a catalog, building out massive stores and opening adjacent restaurant and wine bars.

title: Transparent Medical Prices Will Help Somewhat
summary: With the exception of surgery centers, some for-profit hospitals and small primary-care practices, essentially no one knows what a discrete episode of care actually costs.. Regarding Dr. Scott W. Atlas's "Shop Till Medical Costs Drop" (op-ed, June 7): I find it disheartening to read a physician say that health care will work better if patients carry more personal risk for health-care costs, and therefore just need to negotiate for price. As someone who has spent 40 years evaluating health-care cost, utilization and quality, I find it hard to see how patients can realistically and successfully negotiate with hospitals, surgeons, anesthesiologists, radiologists, pathologists and internists for their needed care. How do patients negotiate with the ambulance that responded to a 911 call and transports the patient to a hospital without having had prior negotiation on price? How does a patient negotiate with a drug company whose main office may be in Switzerland, when the doctor presents the patient with a cancer diagnosis and advises which drugs are best for their treatment?

title: Socialists, Knowledge of History and Agency
summary: I have always seen people as individuals who could aspire to and achieve something better despite (or even because of) life's adversities. The worldview of the majority of my academic colleagues tends to see individuals as helpless cogs.. Joseph Epstein's "Socialists Don't Know History" (op-ed, May 30) on the abysmal historical knowledge of young people brings to mind the prophesy of the keenest of economists, Joseph Schumpeter, in 1942 when he said that capitalism would destroy itself by breeding a "new class: bureaucrats, intellectuals, professors, lawyers, journalists, all of them beneficiaries and, in fact, parasitical on them and yet, all of them opposed to the ethos of wealth production, of saving and of allocating resources to economic productivity." The 77 years since then has proven Schumpeter a major prophet

title: End of a Silly California Coffee Cancer Scare
summary: While I am glad that the state has made an exception under Prop. 65 for roasted coffee, what about producers of other products with smaller association budgets which can't afford a public-relations company?. Regarding your editorial "Coffee Doesn't Kill After All" (June 6): It is encouraging that the state of California has finally recognized that coffee may not have the adverse side effects California's Proposition 65 claims it does. When coffee roasters were sued under California's Prop. 65, dubbed the Safe Drinking Water and Toxic Enforcement Act of 1986, they launched an admirable public-relations campaign to point out how far Prop. 65 has gone in the state. When a judge agreed that coffee, according to California law, required a toxic-chemical warning label, that judge was correctly interpreting the language of Prop. 65 and the chemicals that are required to carry warning labels. Thankfully, the state recognized this and granted coffee an exception.

title: Google Axes Lobbyists Amid Growing Government Scrutiny
summary: Tech giant fires lobbying firms, shuffles leadership of its policy-influencing operations. WASHINGTON-Google has fired about a half-dozen of its largest lobbying firms as part of a major overhaul of its global government affairs and policy operations amid the prospect of greater government scrutiny of its businesses.

title: New Jersey Lawmakers Push to Extend Corporate Tax Credits
summary: Democratic governor wants to let programs expire at the end of June. New Jersey lawmakers are scrambling to temporarily extend the state's tax-incentive programs before their June 30 expiration, despite Gov. Phil Murphy's wishes to end them.

title: The Fed Needs to Be the Adult in the Economy
summary: Amid unpredictable actors, Chairman Powell must project calm and stability as he weighs three distinct risks requiring different and highly nuanced judgments. Alongside full employment and stable prices, the Federal Reserve has another, lesser known mandate: to be the adult in the economy. That's especially true at times like now when events are whipsawed by unpredictable actors at home and abroad.

title: Brooks Koepka's Winding Path to Become Golf's No. 1 Player
summary: The two-time defending U.S. Open champion honed his game in outposts such as Hyvinkää, Finland, and Almaty, Kazakhstan, before rising to the top of the sport. PEBBLE BEACH, Calif.-More than any other major championship, the U.S. Open is designed to instill fear in players. Yet no matter how fast the greens or how high the rough, nothing about this week is likely to make Brooks Koepka as anxious as he was one night before the 2013 Kenya Open.

title: The Woman Leading PBS Through TV's Time of Turmoil
summary: Paula Kerger discusses why she isn't afraid of Netflix, sharing 'Sesame Street' with HBO and how to cultivate female CEOs. When Paula Kerger took over as chief executive of PBS in 2006, "Downton Abbey" hadn't yet made its debut and Charlie Rose and Tavis Smiley were mainstays. Netflix hadn't yet moved into streaming and Apple had just begun selling TV episodes via iTunes.

title: Sex-Abuse Accusations Grow Against Catholic Clergy in Poland
summary: More people allege childhood incidents after YouTube video causes outcry, raising prospect of a public reckoning like Ireland's. WARSAW-The Catholic Church in Poland has seen an uptick in accusations from people claiming to have been sexually abused by clergy as children, after a YouTube video sparked public anger at an institution that is at the political and social heart of this culturally conservative country.

title: China's Small Banks Run Into More Trouble
summary: Yields on NCDs have risen sharply for lowly rated issuers. "There aren't 300 pieces of silver here," the Chinese say, referencing the apocryphal tale of a man who buried 300 pieces of silver under a sign bearing these words. The silver was stolen by his neighbor, who left a different note: "Neighbor Wang didn't steal."

title: Sprint, T-Mobile Merger Chances Take Another Hit
summary: The companies have suffered a significant setback as they await Justice Department approval for their union. T-Mobile 's and Sprint 's plans to combine in a $26 billion deal seemed to be swimming along smoothly, especially after the merger received backing from the Federal Communications Commission's chairman last month.

title: Puerto Rico Pension Deal Scales Back on Planned Cuts to Retiree Benefits
summary: Proposed deal with U.S. territory's federal overseers would keep 61% of retirees whole, up from 25%. Puerto Rico's federal overseers have agreed to roll back some planned pension cuts under a proposed settlement with retirees, a key step toward wrapping up the largest U.S. municipal bankruptcy.

title: As China Auto Sales Slow, Industry Braces for New Regulations
summary: Emissions standards due to come into effect a year earlier than planned have dealers scrambling to move old cars from their lots. SHANGHAI-Auto sales in China declined for an 11th straight month in May, with the slump in demand showing no sign of easing and the country's automotive industry bracing for losses tied to new emissions standards.

title: If Your Future Flights to Europe Feel More Cramped, Here's Why
summary: The new Airbus A321LR could fundamentally change trips across the Atlantic-they could cost less, but at the expense of valuable seat space. How long will passengers sit in a small, tightly packed airplane? Soon, the answer from airlines will be: longer.

title: Cloud Gaming May Be Microsoft's to Lose
summary: Software giant is covering all bases with multipronged approach to videogame streaming. The future of cloud-enabled videogame streaming remains a murky one. What is clear at this point is that Microsoft is setting itself up to win-regardless of who else does.

title: Durex Owner Names Pepsi Executive as CEO
summary: Laxman Narasimhan, currently Pepsi's global chief commercial officer, will join Reckitt Benckiser in July. LONDON- Reckitt Benckiser Group PLC has tapped one of PepsiCo . Inc.'s most senior people to be its new chief executive, as the supplier of Durex condoms and Dettol cleaning products looks to revive growth after a challenging few years.

title: Nintendo Moves Some Switch Production Out of China, Adapting to Tariff Threat
summary: Some console production shifts to Southeast Asia. TOKYO- Nintendo Co. is shifting some production of its Switch videogame console to Southeast Asia from China to limit the impact of possible U.S. tariffs on Chinese-made electronics, said people who work on Nintendo's supply chain.

title: China Brokerage's $2 Billion Offering Kick-Starts London Stock Link
summary: U.S. trade tensions have given Beijing more incentive to roll out the long-planned program after months of delay. SHANGHAI-Chinese brokerage Huatai Securities Co. plans to raise as much as $2 billion selling London-listed share-backed instruments this week, reviving a delayed financial link between China and the U.K.

title: Facebook Finds Itself on Receiving End of Fake Video
summary: CEO appears to question social-media company's data practices. Facebook Inc. is getting its own taste of video fakery less than two weeks after the company was slammed by U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi for declining to take down a doctored video of her.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Wisconsin Group That Negotiated Foxconn Deal Has Oversight Problems, Audit Finds
summary: Economic development group that helped bring Foxconn to Wisconsin awarded incentives to companies that ultimately didn't create jobs they had promised. The Wisconsin group that negotiated $3 billion in tax incentives for Foxconn Technology Group has problematic oversight practices, a state audit has found, raising fresh concerns about the costly incentives states use to attract economic growth.

title: In Memos, Acting Defense Chief Reminds Troops to Remain 'Apolitical'
summary: Warning comes after White House asked that USS McCain be kept 'out of sight'. Acting Defense Secretary Pat Shanahan in two department-wide memos Tuesday told U.S. military personnel to remain apolitical at all times, a reminder that comes after the White House last month asked defense officials to keep the USS John S. McCain "out of sight" ahead of a presidential visit to Japan.

title: Trump, Biden Face Off in Iowa in Potential 2020 Election Preview
summary: President won the state in 2016, but Democrats hope his trade policies will help them next year. WEST DES MOINES, Iowa-President Trump and former Vice President Joe Biden exchanged barbs from opposite ends of Iowa on Tuesday, offering a preview of a potential general election face-off.

title: New York's Top Lawmakers Reach Rent-Law Deal
summary: Bills would make regulations permanent for one million apartments in New York City. ALBANY-Democrats reached an agreement on bills to strengthen and make permanent rent regulations affecting about one million apartments in New York City, Senate Majority Leader Andrea Stewart-Cousins said Tuesday.

title: Thousands of Protesters Block Hong Kong Roads Over China Extradition Bill
summary: Mass protests Sunday that organizers say drew one million people have failed to derail the bill. HONG KONG-Thousands of protesters blocked roads around Hong Kong's legislature early Wednesday as lawmakers were set to debate a widely unpopular proposed law that would allow people to be extradited to China.

title: Economist Martin Feldstein Has Died at Age 79
summary: Feldstein was chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers from 1982 to 1984 under President Reagan. Martin Feldstein, a top adviser to presidents and one of the most influential academic economists of his generation, died Tuesday at the age of 79.

title: Southern Baptists Approve Steps to Address Sexual Abuse
summary: Nation's largest Protestant denomination votes to change constitution to allow expulsion of churches that mishandle allegations. The country's largest Protestant denomination, the Southern Baptist Convention, took steps Tuesday to crack down on churches that mishandle sexual-abuse allegations, following a year of heavy of criticism on the issue.

title: Deutsche Bank Warns Clients They Could Be Cut Off in Compliance Effort
summary: Latest Deutsche Bank letters seek documentation from around 1,000 investment-bank clients. Deutsche Bank AG has given around 1,000 investment-banking clients a month or less to hand over company-ownership information and other documentation in the bank's protracted effort to close compliance gaps, according to the bank and people familiar with the demands.

title: U.S.-Russia Ties at Most Dangerous Point in Years, Says a Top Moscow Diplomat
summary: Deputy foreign minister rules out new arms-control deals 'until the U.S. is ready for it'. MOSCOW-Relations between the U.S. and Russia are at their most dangerous point in years, said a top Russian diplomat, with the two rivals locked in a stalemate over how to revive an important Cold War-era arms treaty and President Vladimir Putin blaming Washington for failing to undertake talks on new weapons pacts.

title: Drones to Carry People Have Yet to Take Off, but They Will Have a Place to Land
summary: Interest in landing pads, even at an early stage, underscores how investors see big opportunity despite risks. SYDNEY-A small group of entrepreneurs is betting that when the next generation of autonomous, people-carrying drones is ready to take off, they will need a place to land.

title: Defense Contractors Join Forces as Pentagon Spending Slows
summary: Merger of United Technologies, Raytheon underscores consolidation that has seen 17,000 firms pull out. A merger that would be the aerospace-and-defense industry's biggest ever caps two years of deal making in a sector that is reorganizing in anticipation of slower growth in Pentagon spending and new priorities such as space systems and hypersonic missiles.

title: Insys Bankruptcy Could Complicate Test Case Against Opioid Makers
summary: Drug company has asked a bankruptcy court to halt action against it in bellwether Ohio trial. The bankruptcy of Insys Therapeutics Inc. could complicate a closely watched trial against major opioid drugmakers and distributors set to begin in October in Ohio federal court.

title: Pilot Killed in Helicopter Crash Couldn't Navigate in Bad Weather
summary: Timothy McCormack was experienced but lacked certification to use instruments critical for handling difficult conditions. The pilot who died when his helicopter crash-landed on a Midtown Manhattan skyscraper Monday wasn't certified to fly using instruments that could have helped him navigate in poor weather, according to Federal Aviation Administration records.
